alert.note: Alert for Eastern Currituck; Western Currituck (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 10:07PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Currituck and the southeastern City of Virginia Beach through 1100 PM EDT... At 1007 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Currituck, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and heavy downpours will be possible. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Virginia Beach, Currituck, Moyock, Knotts Island, Corolla, Barco, Snowden, Waterlily, Sligo, Munden, Maple and Shawboro. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
